title.narrative: Cyclone Mora Response: Rehabilitation and Provisions for Damaged Schools in Central Rakhine State

description.narrative:
This project is to be conducted in partnership by the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) and Lutheran World Federation (LWF) as a response to the damages caused by Mora Cyclone in Rakhine State. The project aims to rehabilitate and provide furniture provisions (desks, chairs, and classroom items) to formal schools as well as Temporary Learning Spaces (TLSs) and Child Friendly Spaces (CFSs) in internally displaced persons (IDP) camps and IDP relocated areas that were damaged by Cyclone Mora in Central Rakhine State (CRS). This activity is in-line with the strategic goals of NRC and LWF education programming in the target area designed specifically for improving the learning environment and to provide conducive and safe learning spaces and thus contributing to the overall quality of learning in the target communities. It takes into consideration the gender disparity/differential in access to education. The absence of freedom of movement has made access to both girls and boys (with varying degree) more challenging, according to available data. The project will target formal schools in out-of-camp host communities and TLSs and CFSs in IDP camps in CRS, aimed at primary and post-primary school children. The destruction of formal schools by Cyclone Mora on 30 May 2017 justifies the need for intervention and response to rehabilitate schools in CRS.
Currently, schools in CRS are in a state of disarray. Hampered by years of neglect, compounded by the impact of Cyclone Mora, schools at all education levels are in a need of physical repair and additional educational provisions. Similarly, the majority of TLSs and CFSs supported by LWF in IDP camps in Sittwe and Pauktaw townships were forced to close due to severe damages. The lack of funding to respond to the damages delayed the process of rebuilding collapsed TLSs/CFS and renovating those that were partially damaged. The project will support the rehabilitation and repair of debilitated and damaged formal schools and TLSs/CFSs in IDP camps and IDP relocated areas in CRS, incorporating ‘Build Back Better’ principles, while also providing educational equipment to allow for safe and continuous education for children. Therefore, both rehabilitating formal schools and outfitting them with educational provisions in out-of-camp host communities and reconstructing/renovating TLSs/CFSs in IDP camps and IDP relocated areas will help re-establish a conducive and safe learning environment for the children attending and continuing education.
The NRC plans to rehabilitate four primary schools in host community villages, and LWF plans to rebuild three TLSs and one CFS as well as repair 32 TLSs/CFSs in IDP camps and IDP relocated areas in CRS, with consultation of SED and TEOs. The NRC and LWF will implement this project specifically targeting primary and post-primary school children and teachers whose schools were damage by Cyclone Mora. Interventions will consider specific adaptation for children with physical disabilities.
